intro: Satyria leucostoma, commonly known as the white-flowered satyria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight pubescence. Satyria leucostoma is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in forested or coastal areas.
